x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: When a major disaster (flood, earthquake, wildfire) destroys physical government offices, all critical records like property deeds, land titles, and building permits are lost. Without these papers, citizens cannot prove ownership, get insurance payments, or secure permits to rebuild, leading to recovery delays that can last years.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A highly secure, centralized digital vault built on the ServiceNow Platform to manage and verify critical property records:

  • Secure Records Management (Custom Tables/CMDB): Used as the backbone for storing encrypted, versioned, and disaster-proof digital copies of property deeds, maps, and official permits.
  • Customer Service Management (CSM) Portal: A secure, mobile-friendly portal where citizens can access and instantly download their verified property documents after a disaster.
  • Case Management & Workflow: Automates the verification process for insurance claims and government rebuilding applications, linking the claim directly to the secured property record.
  • Public Sector Digital Services (PSDS): Provides the necessary governance layer to ensure records are legally auditable and meet compliance standards.
